oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Gathering at Sycamore Shoals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Painting showing a large gathering at Sycamore Shoals (patriots from Tennessee coming together for the march to King's Mountain in the Carolinas).
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Paintings; Picture frames; Dogs; Horses; Soldiers; Women; Children
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 1780 patriot frontier militia groups gathered for a 14-day march over the Blue Ridge Mountains toward King's Mountain to fight British Loyalists during the Revolutionary War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
